alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 1:20AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Laurel, northeastern Pulaski, southwestern Jackson and southeastern Rockcastle Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 120 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pongo, or 11 miles south of Mount Vernon, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wood Creek Lake, Hazel Patch, Camp Wildcat and Bunch around 130 AM EDT. Hare, Bernstadt, Mershons and Lamero around 135 AM EDT. London, Carmichael, East Bernstadt and Victory around 140 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pittsburg, Maplesville, Sublimity City, Atlanta, London-Corbin Airport, Greenmount, Levi Jackson S.P., Mcwhorter and Fariston. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 35 and 58. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 11. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 34 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
